name: Apple Inc.
description: Leading technology company behind iPhone, Mac, and other major hardware/software.

name: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.
description: World's largest chip foundry; Apple’s exclusive chip fabricator.

name: Hon Hai Precision Industry
description: Primary contract manufacturer for Apple, assembling most iPhones/devices.

name: Samsung Electronics
description: Major smartphone competitor and key supplier of components to Apple.

name: Alphabet Inc.
description: Operates Android OS and mobile services; Apple’s chief ecosystem competitor.

name: Qualcomm
description: Supplies Apple's cellular modem chips for iPhones; critical technology partner.

name: Broadcom
description: Supplies critical wireless chips (Wi-Fi/Bluetooth) to Apple devices.

name: Sony
description: Supplies camera sensors for iPhones and other Apple products.

name: LG Display
description: Supplies display panels for Apple devices; key in screen technology.

name: SK Hynix
description: Provides memory chips used in Apple products.

name: Micron Technology
description: Memory chip supplier for Apple devices.

name: Pegatron
description: Key assembly partner for Apple, building iPhones and iPads.

name: Luxshare Precision
description: Key assembler/manufacturer for AirPods and some iPhones.

name: Wistron
description: Taiwanese manufacturer assembling devices for Apple.

name: Epic Games
description: Prominent app developer; sued Apple over App Store policies.

name: Global Smartphone Market
description: Primary industry driving Apple’s core business and revenue.

name: Semiconductor & Chip Industry
description: Industry determining chip supply/innovation for Apple's products.

name: Mobile App Economy & Services Sector
description: Sector defining app distribution and digital services revenue for Apple.

name: Personal Computing Industry
description: Sector shaping competition around Apple’s Mac business.

name: Wearables & Consumer Electronics Sector
description: Industry segment influencing Apple Watch, AirPods, consumer device strategies.

name: Telecommunications Industry
description: Sector of wireless carriers and standards (5G/6G) affecting iPhone distribution.

name: Retail and E-commerce Industry
description: Industry segment affecting product distribution and customer experience for Apple.

name: iPhone
description: Apple’s flagship smartphone product and largest revenue driver.

name: App Store
description: Apple’s mobile app distribution platform; core of its services revenue.

name: Apple Services
description: Division including App Store, Apple Music, iCloud, Apple TV+, Apple Pay, etc.

name: macOS & Mac Hardware
description: Apple’s desktop and laptop computers and operating system.

name: iPad
description: Apple’s tablet product line; major presence in education and enterprise.

name: Apple Watch
description: Apple’s smartwatch, leading the wearables market segment.

name: AirPods
description: Apple’s popular wireless earbuds, major in wearables revenue.

name: Android
description: Google’s mobile operating system and main iOS competitor.

name: ARM Architecture
description: Chip instruction set architecture critical to Apple's custom silicon.

name: U.S. Department of Justice
description: US federal agency suing Apple for antitrust; directly impacting business model.

name: European Commission
description: EU authority enforcing digital markets regulation affecting Apple policies in Europe.

name: Chinese Government and Regulatory Bodies
description: National authorities controlling Apple’s access and compliance in China.

name: U.S.–China Trade Policy
description: International policy affecting Apple’s costs, supply chain, and market stability.

name: U.S. Congress
description: Legislative institution scrutinizing Apple’s business and potential regulatory changes.

name: U.S. Judicial System
description: Courts ruling on antitrust and other legal challenges to Apple.

name: U.S. Federal Trade Commission
description: Oversees consumer protection and antitrust, directly impacting Apple practices.

name: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission
description: Financial regulator overseeing Apple’s financial reporting/disclosures.

name: Japan Fair Trade Commission
description: Japanese competition regulator influencing App Store rules compliance.

name: Competition Commission of India
description: Indian regulator investigating Apple’s App Store practices.

name: South Korean Regulator
description: Competitive authority impacting Apple’s payment systems and app stores in Korea.

name: Tax Authorities and Trade Institutions
description: Entities enforcing tax law and trade rules impacting Apple’s finances.

name: China (Mainland China)
description: Apple’s largest manufacturing hub and key consumer market.

name: United States
description: Apple’s home base, largest single market, and key regulatory environment.

name: European Union
description: Major region for Apple’s sales and digital market compliance enforcement.

name: Taiwan
description: Source of Apple’s key foundries and supply chain partners (TSMC, Foxconn).

name: India
description: Rapidly growing market and key region for Apple’s supply chain diversification.

name: Japan
description: Major consumer and supply partner; large iPhone market share.

name: South Korea
description: Home to Samsung/LG; important as Apple competitor and supplier.

name: Vietnam
description: Emerging manufacturing hub for Apple components and some assembly.

name: Singapore
description: Regional supply chain hub for Apple’s operations.

name: Malaysia
description: Host to Apple’s chip testing and component factories.

name: Thailand
description: Apple assembly location for some Macs.

name: Latin America
description: Emerging market regions influencing Apple’s long-term growth strategies.

name: Middle East
description: Regions with high per-capita iPhone adoption and premium sales potential.

name: Africa
description: Potential future market for Apple, currently low penetration.

name: Tim Cook
description: CEO of Apple Inc.; chief architect of current strategy and operations.

name: Jeff Williams
description: Chief Operating Officer at Apple, responsible for supply chain and health devices.

name: Craig Federighi
description: SVP of Software Engineering, oversees iOS, macOS, and software integration.

name: Johny Srouji
description: SVP of Hardware Technologies, leads custom chip design at Apple.

name: Phil Schiller
description: Apple Fellow and former head of marketing, influences App Store policies.

name: Greg Joswiak
description: SVP of Worldwide Marketing shaping product positioning and launches.

name: Steve Jobs
description: Apple co-founder and former CEO, created Apple’s culture and product vision.

name: Margrethe Vestager
description: EU Competition Commissioner, leading regulatory actions against Apple.

name: Lina Khan
description: Chair of the U.S. FTC, prominent antitrust regulator for tech.

name: Xi Jinping
description: President of China; role in shaping tech policy affecting Apple.

name: Narendra Modi
description: Prime Minister of India; key to Apple’s manufacturing expansion in India.

name: Elon Musk
description: CEO of Tesla/SpaceX; industry peer influencing future Apple strategies.

name: Satya Nadella
description: CEO of Microsoft; leads key Apple partner and competitor.

name: Sundar Pichai
description: CEO of Alphabet/Google; controls Android and Google-Apple partnership.
